metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46871 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An out of date library (libusrsctp) contained vulnerabilities that could potentially be exploited. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 108.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap sbeattie> libusrsctp fixed upstream in 0.9.4.0 specific issue is a failure to perform reference counting correctly, and thus race conditions that lead to use-after-frees are possible.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
